title: North (Hudson) River - Shore and skyline - Manhattan - Battery - 14th Street - [Bankers Trust Company ; New York Aquarium ; Singer Manufacturing Company ; Standard Oil Company ; United States Barge Office ; Whitehall Building ; Woolworth Building ; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company ; Continental Bank and Trust Company ; Irving Trust Company ; 60 Wall Street Tower.]

North (Hudson) River - Shore and skyline - Manhattan - Battery - 14th Street - [Bankers Trust Company ; New York Aquarium ; Singer Manufacturing Company ; Standard Oil Company ; United States Barge Office ; Whitehall Building ; Woolworth Building ; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company ; Continental Bank and Trust Company ; Irving Trust Company ; 60 Wall Street Tower.]

text:
General View--East Side Lower Manhattan: Viewing northeastward across the east side of Lower Manhattan lying along the East River shore. On the left (view 1) is the Cotton Exchange building and in the center background is the 120 Wall Street Building under construction. The Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges are in the background.

View 2 is from a point farther south and is across the low-roofed slum area of the Lower East Side.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: April 28, 1929
View 2: March 27, 1931
title: General view - East side of Lower Manhattan.

folder: Piers 13-14 - Manhattan - South Street - Wall Street - Maiden Lane - [American Sugar Refining Company; Bank of Manhattan; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company; 60 Wall Street Tower.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
East River, showing (right to left) piers 13 and 14 of the Ward Line, off South Street, at the foot of Wall Street and Maiden Lane, respectively. Also shown (background) is the shore and skyline of Brooklyn.

August 7, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date, as viewed from the river (pier 13 is on the left). The tall buildings in the background are (right to left): 60 Wall Tower, Bank of Manhattan, American Sugar Refining and City Bank Farmers Trust Buildings.

September 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Piers 13-14 - Manhattan - South Street - Wall Street - Maiden Lane - [American Sugar Refining Company; Bank of Manhattan; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company; 60 Wall Street Tower.]

folder: Brooklyn Bridge - Bank of Manhattan; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company; Equitable Trust Company ; Irving Trust Company; Singer Manufacturing Company; 60 Wall Street Tower., Manhattan, NY
text:
A general view southward from the Brooklyn Bridge, showing the skyscrapers and office buildings constituting the financial district. From left to right the outstanding buildings are, No. 120 Wall Street, the City Bank-Farmers Trust Co., the Sixty Wall Tower, the Bank of Manhattan, the Irving Trust Co., the Equitable and the Singer. Views 2 and 3 are similar. Note in the center foreground of the former, the South Ferry Divison of the Second and Third Avenue "El" running on Pearl Street. Above same appears the smokestacks of the New York Steam Co. plant. To the right are the 25 and 28 story buildings comprising the insurance center around John and Platt Streets.

View 1   Sept. 23, 1931
Views: 2 and 3 June 5, 1932

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - Brooklyn Bridge - Bank of Manhattan; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company; Equitable Trust Company ; Irving Trust Company; Singer Manufacturing Company; 60 Wall Street Tower.]

text: The Naval Airship AKRON flying over the incompleted Cities Service Bldg (60 Wall St) Nov 2, 1931. This was the airship's maiden flight over NYC.
title: Airships - [Naval airship "Akron" flying over 60 Wall Street Tower.]

folder: Pier 1 - South ferry., Manhattan, NY
text:
East River, at South Ferry, showing Pier No. 1, the Staten Island Ferry Slip. In the background are the 60 Wall St. Tower Building and the City Bank Farmers Trust Co. building; the latter having been erected recently.

May 1, 1931.

P. L. Sperr,
title: East River - Pier 1 - South ferry.

folder: South ferry ; Williamsburg bridge., NY
text:
East River, skyline of Lower Manhattan, as viewed in a westerly direction from pier 11, off South Street, at the foot of Jones Lane. The skyscrapers as they appear from right to left are: the 60 Wall Tower, Bank of Manhattan, City Bank Farmers Trust and (left) the 6-story U.S. Assay Office Buildings, with its narrow funnel-like addition.

Wurtz Brothers.

1932.
title: East River - shore and skyline ; South ferry ; Williamsburg bridge.

folder: South ferry ; Williamsburg bridge., NY
text:
East River, at Old Slip, showing barges docked off South Street and part of the Lower Manhattan skyline. In the center appears the 60 Wall Tower Building and on the extreme left; the Bank of Manhattan Trust Co. Building (in part).

February 1, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - shore and skyline ; South ferry ; Williamsburg bridge.

folder: Piers 16-17 - Manhattan - South Street - [Bank of Manhattan; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company; 60 Wall Street Tower.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Piers Nos. 16 and 17, (left to right) East River, east side of South Street. Also shown is the west side of South Street, between Fulton Street and Burling Slip. A general view of downtown Manhattan appears with the Woolworth Building on the right. March 10, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a slightly different angle. March 10, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, another view. The tall structures are (left to right): The City Bank Farmers Trust, 60 Wall Tower and Bank of Manhattan (in part) Buildings.

P. L. Sperr.

October 1, 1934.
title: East River - Piers 16-17 - Manhattan - South Street - [Bank of Manhattan; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company; 60 Wall Street Tower.]

folder: Piers 9-11 - Manhattan - South Street - Old Slip - Jones Lane - [American Sugar Refining Company; Municipal Building; Woolworth Building; 60 Wall Street Tower.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
East River, showing (left to right) piers 9 and 11, off South Street, at the foot of Old Slip and Jones Lane, respectively. In the background appear (right to left): the Municipal, American Sugar Refining, Woolworth, 60 Wall Tower and the 99-101 Wall Street Buildings.
August 23, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, as seen from pier 9. Pier 11 is largely obstructed from view by barges. The American Sugar Refining Building (120 Wall Street) is prominently visible in the background.
August 1, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Piers 9-11 - Manhattan - South Street - Old Slip - Jones Lane - [American Sugar Refining Company; Municipal Building; Woolworth Building; 60 Wall Street Tower.]

folder: Cliff Street & Ferry Street., Manhattan, NY
Piers 16-20 - Manhattan - South Street  - Peck Slip - John Street - [Federal Court House; Municipal Building; Bank of Manhattan; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company; 60 Wall Street Tower.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
East River, showing piers 20 to 16, off South Street, south from peck Slip to John Street. Also shown is the skyline of Lower Manhattan, with the Bank of Manhattan, 60 Wall Tower and City Bank Farmers Trust Buildings, appearing from right to left in the center.
September 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr,

(2)
A closer view of piers 18 and 19 as viewed from the opposite direction (northwestward) from pier 17. In the background are shown (left to right) the Municipal Building, U.S. Court House, and the Brooklyn Bridge.
August 2, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A view of piers 17 and 19 (pier 18 is obscured from sight by the schooners which are docked alongside of it) as viewed in a northerly direction from pier 16. In the background is the Brooklyn Bridge.
August 2, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Piers 16-20 - Manhattan - South Street - Peck Slip - John Street - [Federal Court House; Municipal Building; Bank of Manhattan; City Bank-Farmers Trust Company; 60 Wall Street Tower.]

folder: South Ferry - Williamsburg Bridge - [60 Wall Street Tower - American Sugar Refining Company.], Manhattan, NY
text:
East River, shore and skyline, at Wall Street and showing prominently the 60 Wall Street Tower and the Sugar Refining Building. On the extreme right appears the Municipal Building.

July 19, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline - South Ferry - Williamsburg Bridge - [60 Wall Street Tower - American Sugar Refining Company.]

text:
Manhattan Financial District Roof Tops Looking from Roof of 60 Wall St. tower

Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer

[Note: negative at Museum of the City of New York]
Code I F
June 9, 1938
title: General view - Downtown Manhattan.

folder: [Wall Street outline, Manhattan.], Manhattan, NY
text:
East River, shore and skyline, Manhattan: Two views, photographed westward from the Brooklyn shore, showing the Wall Street outline. Dominating same is the spired 60 Wall Tower. To the left are buildings identified with various banking houses and to the right, the new insurance center.

The photographer gives his vantage point as Fulton Street and itemizes the steamer as the "M & J. Tracy" and the Tug as the property of the "Cleveland-Pennsylvania Railroad".

Views 1;2
1938
Gift of the Museum Photographers Association
Beecher Ogden, photo
title: East River - Shore and skyline - [Wall Street outline, Manhattan.]

title: East River - Shore and skyline - [Wall Street outline, Manhattan.]

folder: [Outline of the Wall Street financial district.], Manhattan, NY
text:
East River shore and skyline--Manhattan: The famed outline of the Wall Street financial zone as photographed from under the East River's Brooklyn Bridge. The three outstanding structures are, the City Bank-Farmers Trust, the 60 Wall Tower and the Bank of Manhattan. To the right center appears the Singer Tower, an outstanding building of a generation ago.

Alexander Alland

1939
title: East River - Shore and skyline - Manhattan - [Outline of the Wall Street financial district.]
